p: Participants’ misunderstanding of disease terms (“influenza” versus “flu”) and the characteristics of influenza demonstrate partial knowledge. Two participants noted the similarities of influenza and cold symptoms but claimed that they have not experienced or been infected with influenza. However, previous studies noted that non-health professionals cannot clearly differentiate influenza from the common cold [ 43]. Furthermore, in its precise definition, influenza is not a “sickness of the lungs” but rather a respiratory disease that leads to fever and can infect the lungs which may also lead to the development of pneumonia for at-risk individuals.
